greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the largest integer k such that 2^k - 1 divides n.
comment: Conjecture: gcd(n, m) = a(2^n + 2^m - 2) for n > 0 and m > 0. - _Velin Yanev_, Aug 24 2017
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: A161789 := proc(n) for k from ilog2(n+1) to 0 by -1 do if n mod (2^k-1) = 0 then RETURN(k); fi; od: end: seq(A161789(n),n=1..120) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 27 2009
for k from 2 to ilog2(N) do
program: (PARI) a(n)=forstep(k=logint(n+1,2),1,-1, if(n%(2^k-1)==0, return(k))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 25 2017
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Jun 19 2009
